name: hybridized
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
biology
  specialized (of a plant or animal) formed from two different types of plant or animal: Genetically speaking, thesehybridised creatures would not quite be full clones. Many people are allergic to hybridized peanuts.
formed from two different things and having features of both of them: Industrial nations now have hybridized styles of government which are part capitalist, part socialist, and part mercantile (run by big business). The artist is interested in the hybridised culture of contemporary society.
More examplesFewer examplesMany of the trees in the area are hybridized oaks.Seed producers developed hybridized varieties that would meet the needs of large-scale growers.The international, hybridized culture of immigrants has transformed the city.Hawaiian music has always been the most hybridised music in the whole Pacific, because the island was the most impacted by other people.
